channel.title: Getting_started on Keydra Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Getting_started on Keydra Documentation

item.title: Initial Bitbucket Setup
item.description: To use Bitbucket for your config source, read on. If needed, you can create a free account here. Setup a configuration repository Create a new private repository in Bitbucket. Let’s call it KeydraConfiguration. Clone your new repo locally. Click the Clone button at the top right of your new repo’s Source page, and paste into your terminal. Note: You may need to setup an SSH key for this, see here for help if needed.

item.title: Initial Github Setup
item.description: To use Github for your config source, read on. Setup a configuration repository Create a new private repository in Github. Let’s call it KeydraConfiguration. Clone your new repo locally. Click the Clone button in your new repo, and paste into your terminal. git clone git@github.com:<your Github org or username>/keydraconfiguration.git cd keydraconfiguration Create a Personal Access Token From your repository in your browser, click Settings from your profile avatar in the top right corner.

item.title: Initial Gitlab Setup
item.description: To use Gitlab as your config source, read on. Setup a configuration repository Create a new repository in Gitlab. Let’s call it KeydraConfiguration. Clone your new repo locally. Create a Personal Access Token Follow the instructions to create a personal access token. https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/profile/personal_access_tokens.html Log into to the AWS Console and navigate to the Secrets Manager service. Click the orange Store a new secret button. Choose a secret type of Other type of secrets, and add a plaintext secret as follows (substituting your details).
